name: Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Control Checklist - Digging / Excavating (incl. marking out & potholing existing services).
• Notify Worksafe NZ if required. Ensure all necessary Permit to Works & Controlled Checklists are in place
Detail - Ensure TMP is approved and check that the requirements are correctly interpreted and understood by the STMS
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - TMP is approved by AT for the site and works are only completed within the approved dates
Detail - Ensure that Sub-Contract and Supplier Agreements are signed,  all Sub-Contractors and Suppliers are inducted to site
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Signed Subcontract and Supplier Agreements on M-Files and Induction Register updated
Records - Subcontract and Supplier Agreements, A & Updated Induction Register
Detail - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - IFC Label on drawings
Detail - Check constructed Sub base is within level tolerance.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Survey
Detail - Set out Vehicle Crossing transition points and Pedestrian Drop Downs.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Survey, Measurement and Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Kerbing  Specification and Geometrics Drawing
Detail - Mortar consist of two parts fine, sharp sand to one part of cement.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Delivery Docket
Conformance Criteria - Must be discarded if not used within 30mins of mixing
Detail - Precast work shall be 20MPa concrete Concrete haunching to also be 20MPa in accordance with ATCoP
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Delivery Docket
Conformance Criteria - Check product & dockets upon arrival onsite
• Mix Design is approved prior to any concrete being delivered to site by Design Engineer
Records - Delivery Dockets, Mix Design report
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Lab Testing
Detail - Preforated filter sleeve Drain Pipe to be placed minimium 375mm below subgrade bedded and covered with F/2 sand
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Site Check
Conformance Criteria - As per TDM Technical standards RD0100
Detail - All chamfer to be 20mm, kerb joints to be 10mm min cement mortared
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection and Measurement
Conformance Criteria - To ensure the correct kerb types are installed at the correct locations
Detail - If Existing Subgrade <3% or CIV<7 (if granular), undercut required and bakcfilled with appropriate material and at depth for Design Engineer to specify.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Testing
Detail - Kerbing must be laid on 300mm min GAP 65 subbase in Road and 100mm GAP 40 on Footpaths.
• The subbase for the K&C must be Clegg Tested with no CIV<30
• Concrete haunching must be done as per drawings.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Testing
Conformance Criteria - Pavement depth and type under the kerb varies depending on location. CIV for foundations >=30
Detail - If the existing Subgrade material <3% CBR or CIV<7 if granular, Undercut 300mm and backfill with Granular GAP 40. Design Engineer to Specify Depth.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Testing
Detail - The Kassel Kerbs must be laid on minimum 15 MPa Concrete at correct 200mm thickness on GAP65 subbase CIV >15
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Test/Site Check
Detail - If the existing Subgrade material <CBR 3% or CIV <7 (if granular), Increase base thickness by upto 100mm at the discretion of Design Engineer
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Lab/test
Conformance Criteria - Subgrade material >3% or CIV>= 7
Records - QA Sheets, Design Engineer Correspondence
Detail - The sub-base must be GAP40 and must be clegg tested at every 10m intervals
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Lab/test
Detail - Concrete must be minimum of 20 Mpa and must be of correct 150mm thickness
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Exposed finish compliant with NZS3104 and constructed accordance with NZS3109
Detail - Kerbs laid out accurately to lines, gradients & levels shown in drawings.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection and Measurement
Conformance Criteria - Prior to laying, string lines or levels to be inspected by Engineers Rep.

• When a 3 m straight edge is laid parallel to any surface of a pre-cast or bluestone kerb and channel there shall be no more than 5 mm variation from the straight edge, except at change of grades or curves
Detail - Contraction joints at a maximum of 3m intervals.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection and Measurement
Detail - Top surface to channels to be finished smooth and even with a trowel.
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Shall not pond any water.
Detail - Ensure Kerb & channel to be cut and tied-in with pre-cast components by forming concrete aprons
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Work Instruction
Detail - Channel joint material set flush with surfaces (ensure levels are within the tolerances).
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Channel Specifications
Detail - Catchpit frame, grating and back entry kerb installed at correct level
Inspection / Test Method (Submission, Visual Inspection, Testing, Measurement, Review) - Document review visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Document review visual inspection
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
